data.title: This course is taught by Dr. Jennifer Garza at UNL. These notes are about Ivan
data.meta_description: This course is taught by Dr. Jennifer Garza at UNL. These notes are about Ivan iv. event timeline 1530: ivan is born 1533: at age ivan comes to the throne as
data.text:
Event timeline

1530: Ivan is born

1533: at age 3 Ivan comes to the throne as Grand duke of moscow

1538: Ivans mom died supposedly of poisoning boyars- kept him <prisoner= (bad clothes and food)

1547: Ivan at 16 had himself crowned czar

1550: code of laws

1547-1560: Ivan’s <good period= got married to Anastasia Romanov and had many victories against the mongols

1560: Anastasia dies and Ivan’s <bad period= begins, revenge against boyars = oprichniki (police force) kills boyars harshly

1581: during a brawl, ivan accidentally kills his older son and heir, leaving his younger, weaker son as heir to the throne

1584: Ivan the terrible dies

Ivan’s contemporaries

England - queen elizabeth 1

Suleiman the magnificent

Phillip 2 of spain

Sigismund 1 of poland

Henry 2 of france

Early Life

Son of vassili 3

Was 3 when named prince- regent and rivals families ruled in his name

Developed a hatred of boyars

At 16 crowned tsar- first to be crowned <Tsars of all the russias=

Marriages

Married 7 times- only first 3 recognized by church

Marriage to anastasia romanov gave him prominent connections

Had 6 children- her death caused him to be suspicious, paranoid and stern

Mother of tsarevitch ivan and fyodor

Government

Issued a code of laws in 1550, the revised code of laws that was issued by his grandfather, ivan 3

Sudebnik

Oprichnina

1000 strong personnel guard. Made of non nobles- first political police

Ruled over separate territory in northern russia former novgorod territory- divided large estates

Reign of terror in novgorod and other cities

Public executions in moscow

Disbanded in 1572

Building of St Basil’s Cathedral

Built by italian architect barma and postnik

Built to communicate victory over Kazan and astrakhan

9th sanctuary built over tomb of vasili the holy fool- cathedral later named for him

Children of Ivan iv

Had 8 children, only 3 survived to adulthood

Tsarevitch ivan ivanovitch

Tsarevitch fyodor

Last child dmitri born by last wife maria nagaya in 1582

Kazan

Armies of khan had repeatedly raided northeastern russia

Conquered khanate of kazan, tatar capital 1552

Astrakhan

1554 and 1560- victory over tatars gave Russia control over all of volga river

Final conquest of muslim empires

Relationship with england

Close ties to england -much trade

1551- muscovy company- allowed british merchants to trade throughout kingdom without paying customs fees

Close relationship with elizabeth i

Other foreign relationships

Wars against ottomans 1568-1570 - ottoman war ended with friendly treaty

Crimean raids- moscow burned 1571- crimean tatars eventually defeated

Beginning of conquest of siberia

Livonian war

1558- attempt to gain access to baltic sea and trade routes

Went on for 14 years

Involved kingdom of sweden, poland and duchy of lithuania

Unsuccessful

Misc

First printing press introduced in moscow

Orthodox church - stoglava synod council of 100- unified rituals and ecclesiastical regulations of country

Zenski sobor- land council
